abstract: Hundreds of Swedes gather outside Stockholm's royal palace to show support for Muslim residents after three suspected arson attacks on mosques; Syrian conflict has boosted number of asylum seekers in Sweden and famous Swedish tolerance is being tested; far-right, anti-immigrant Sweden Democrats has grown despite fact that roughly one fifth of Sweden’s 9.6 million people were born abroad or to immigrant parents.
lead_paragraph: Amid the relentless stream of migrants to Europe that has fueled a backlash against immigrants, directed most viciously at Muslims, arson is suspected at mosques in three Swedish cities over the last 10 days.
snippet: Amid the relentless stream of migrants to Europe that has fueled a backlash against immigrants, directed most viciously at Muslims, arson is suspected at mosques in three Swedish cities over the last 10 days.

headline.main: In Sweden, the Land of the Open Door, Anti-Muslim Sentiment Finds a Foothold
headline.print_headline: In Sweden, the Land of the Open Door, Anti-Muslim Sentiment Finds a Foothold
